headline: Homemade Dog Liver Bites
description: Made with either chicken or beef liver, these dog treats are full of protein, easy to make, and freezable. Double the batch for Fido and his friends.
name: Homemade Dog Liver Bites
recipeIngredient: 0.5 pound chicken livers, rinsed and trimmed
1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch square baking dish and line it with parchment paper.
Add oats to the bowl of a food processor; pulse until finely chopped, 10 to 15 seconds. Transfer oats to a large bowl and mix in flour.
Place livers in the food processor and process until smooth, 10 to 15 seconds. Add eggs and blend until well combined, about 10 seconds. Add oil and process until incorporated.
Add liver mixture to oat and flour mixture; stir until well blended. Spoon into the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until firm to the touch but not hard and crispy, 30 to 40 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool completely before cutting into 50 pieces.

review.reviewBody: Used chicken liver and whole wheat flour instead of AP. House smelled disgusting while they were baking but they're a huge hit with my dog!! This was my first time ever cooking treats at home. She drooled the entire time they were cooling. We don't feed treats often, so I threw most of them in a Ziploc and put them in the freezer. 10/10 will definitely be making these regularly!!
My doggies love it
We used coconut flour as it is easier on dogs digestive track vs regular flour..They LOVE them. We vacuum sealed them for better freshness.

My dog loved these, cried whilst they were cooling.i baked them for 30 minutes. Then sliced & diced them up & baked for a further 15 minutes to make them crunchier. Better then store bought. Saving a lot of money & know exactly what's in them
My dogs will do anything for these. I use pigs liver as a cheaper sub for chickens'

My dogs loved it! Circling me like sharks for more ðŸ˜…. Even my kitty ate 2 ðŸ™Œ I did dried them up bit more after cutting in the oven and omitted eggs because of puppy allergies. This are the hit in our house. Thank you for sharing.
My dogs can smell them and can't wait for them to cool
Its my first time and my pooches love it!!! Thank u for the recipe ðŸ˜Ž

My dog (and all the dogs in the neighborhood) LOVE these! I make a double batch using beef liver. I spread them on a cookie sheet to bake, then cut them with a pizza cutter. (Not sure why recipe calls for greasing pan and then using parchment. I just use parchment and they come out fine.) I keep them in the freezer, and just pull out about 3 days worth at a time.

Awesome recipe! My dog loves it! I find they are still too wet after baking and I don't want them going bad. So I when I cut them into bite sized pieces, I bake them again for ten minutes until they are nice and crunchy.
Made according to recipe. My dog would not touch these.
Making these again because they were such a hit with my pup. He loves them so much he has learned some new tricks!
Quick, easy, and my dog loves them! Debating adding parsley for her breathe.

I make a very similar recipe, although I use canned pumpkin, liver ,eggs, oil and flour. The main difference is that I score them before baking, then separate them and put into a dehydrator to remove all moisture. Perfect dog cookies!
Add-ins could include sesame seeds, finely grated apple or zucchini, etc.

I never leave reviews but had to make an account and leave a 5 star review on this one! SO much cheaper than buying dog treats, and pretty easy to make! It does stink up the kitchen a bit, but it is well worth it. I just made a 4x batch for my dog and all his friends. They all love these! Thank you for the recipe!

For my first attempt to make my own dog treats, this recipe was really effective. I doubled the batch and I am very happy with the results. I am using them for high value training treats, and they turned out firm, but slightly soft. They easily cut into very small square, which I can freeze and use as I need them. Thank you for the recipe.

This is a really great recipe, I did add peas, carrots. I also made another with carrots and cranberries, my 3 dogs love them. Whenever I make them, my dogs are sitting right beside me, they'll look in the oven window waiting for them to finish up. Thank you so much for sharing this recipe.
I made it. My beef liver lover dog inhaled it. I only baked it for almost 8 minutes, it turned out great! Definitely a keeper. Thank you very much.

I used beef liver and my dog loved these treats! So much healthier and cheaper than buying packaged "Liver Bites." My photo shows the amount of bites the recipee makes for less than $5 of ingredients versus $16 for the pet shop version.
I froze them in a ziplic baggie and take out a small amount as needed. Sometimes I even feed directly from the freezer.
The recipe doesn't say how long these last in the freezer or in the fridge. I keep mine in the fridge for a week.

I used a one-pound calf liver and doubled the recipe. I used a Vitamix and it worked very well for the oats and liver. I was concerned about feeding my lab puppy oatmeal and wheat flour but he has been eating milk bones for several weeks and this recipe is a thousand times better than what is in a milk bone. My pup absolutely loves these treats.

My dog will literally cry for these biscuits. Super easy with the food processor, sticky when spreading it thinly on the baking sheet(I did this for more crunch) but so worth it. What a great treat, thank you for sharing this recipe!
I used calfâ€™s livers but kept the rest the same. So easy to make. My picky pooch (with chicken allergy) LOVES these! Put two quart size freezer bags in freezer for easy retrieval later.
I made it just like the recipe. My dogs loved them. I've never baked dog biscuits before. A can't go wrong recipe!

Simple recipe to use up my chicken livers left over from processing our chickens. My dogs will do anything for these treats. High motivation treat for our foster dogs. Thanks for the recipe have made 3 batches and love healthy treats my dogs can have.

my dogs love it! simple and awesome.
i used whole wheat flour, beef liver, doubled the recipe for the larger beef liver but didnt double the oats, just did 1 1/2 cups of oats.
Didnâ€™t stink my kitchen up to much and all three of my dogs think they are AMAZING!!! I cut them small and stuck them in the dehydrator for a small crunchy treat.
My dogs LOVED these.
